thread.title: Emmerdale may already be lining up a second Robron wedding | Metro News
thread.title_full: Emmerdale may already be lining up a second Robron wedding | Metro News

author: Duncan Lindsay For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Emmerdale may already be lining up a second Robron wedding | Metro News
text:
Duncan Lindsay for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 6:58 am (Picture: ITV) 
Emmerdale may already be lining up a second Robron wedding for fans of Aaron Dingle and Robert Sugden – with show producer Iain MacLeod teasing that the soap might as well ‘have its wedding cake and eat it’ where the popular couple are concerned. 
With a prison stretch lying ahead for Aaron and the maternity leave of Lucy Pargeter being part of the reason for bringing the original wedding forward, Robron’s first attempt to become husbands is every bit as rushed as it is romantic, with Robert planning the ceremony in the space of a day. 
With the Woolpack not being licensed for weddings and with there being insufficient time for their nuptials to be registered in advance, the wedding isn’t legally official and, while this is not an important factor for Robert and Aaron, it has been suggested they could have another ceremony once Aaron gets out of prison. 
Speaking to Metro.co.uk at a recent Emmerdale event, Danny Miller, who plays Aaron, pondered: ‘A second wedding after Aaron gets out is something that we’ve discussed actually, just between the two of us, bearing in mind that it was so rushed and people had to go sooner than we expected. The story has been sped up so Lucy and Isobel can be there. 
‘I think that there might be something later on but that’s obviously just our opinion, we don’t actually know. We’ve got the storyline in prison and there’s loads more to come before we even think about it.’ 
Boss Iain appeared to be on the same wavelength. He added: ‘It’s inferred that it’s not an “official wedding” so a little sneaky part of me thought we could have two bites of the cherry here if possible although there are no firm plans for part two in place. It feels like, in time they will want to sign and seal the deal legally. We sort of want to have our wedding cake and eat it.’ 
So do we! All the press event gossip!
